title: 3DMark Time Spy
description: Time Spy is a DirectX 12 GPU and CPU benchmark test for gaming PCs running Windows 10 and 11. Time Spy Extreme raises the rendering resolution to 3840 × 2160 (4K UHD) and includes a more demanding CPU test.
longDescription:
# 3DMark Time Spy

Time Spy is a DirectX 12 benchmark test for gaming PCs running Windows 10. With its pure DirectX 12 engine, built from the ground up to support new API features like asynchronous compute, explicit multi-adapter, and multi-threading, Time Spy is the ideal benchmark for testing the DirectX 12 performance of modern graphics cards.

# Unlock Time Spy Extreme

Time Spy Extreme is the world’s first 4K DirectX 12 benchmark test. It is perfect for benchmarking the latest high-end graphics cards and new processors with 8 or more cores. To run Time Spy Extreme, you will need a dedicated GPU with at least 4 GB of video memory.

# Custom settings for DirectX 12 benchmarks

Explore your PC's performance limits with custom benchmark settings. With this upgrade, you can change the rendering resolution and quality settings for DirectX 12 benchmark tests.
- Custom settings for Time Spy Extreme
- Custom settings for Time Spy
- Custom settings for Night Raid

# DirectX 12 Stress Tests

Stress testing is a good way to check the reliability and stability of your system after buying or building a new PC, upgrading your graphics card, or overclocking your GPU. Stress testing can also identify faulty hardware or the need for better cooling.
- Time Spy Extreme Stress Test
- Time Spy Stress Test
- Night Raid Stress Test

# 3DMark Time Spy System Requirements

**OS:** Windows 10 64-bit or Windows 11 64-bit
**Processor:** 1.8Ghz Dual-Core CPU with SSSE3 support
**Memory:** 4 GB
**Graphics:** DirectX 12
**Video memory:** 4 GB
**Storage:** 3 GB free space

# 3DMark Time Spy Extreme System Requirements

**OS:** Windows 10 64-bit or Windows 11 64-bit
**Processor:** 1.8Ghz Dual-Core CPU with SSSE3 support
**Memory:** 4 GB
**Graphics:** DirectX 12
**Video memory:** 4 GB
**Storage:** 3 GB free space

Time Spy Extreme should not be used to benchmark systems with integrated graphics as the rendering will affect the simulation time on such systems due to shared resources.
